p: An additional aspect is that targeting host proteases, such as furin, TMPRSS2 and/or cathepsins, leads to the production of more “all-purpose” drugs, which are not SARS-CoV-2 specific, but they instead may interfere with enveloped-virus entry mechanism, which is common (at least in general terms) to several viruses; therefore, given the growing probability of forthcoming pandemias in the next future, host specific drugs are likely going to be more effective and of more widespread use.
